   19: %%
   20: -module(lc_no_copt_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 basic/1,deeply_nested/1,no_generator/1,
   26: 	 empty_generator/1,no_export/1,shadow/1,
   27: 	 effect/1]).
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   33:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   34: 
   35: all() ->
   36:     [{group,p}].
   37: 
   38: groups() ->
   39:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   40:       [basic,
   41:        deeply_nested,
   42:        no_generator,
   43:        empty_generator,
   44:        no_export,
   45:        shadow,
   46:        effect
   47:       ]}].
   48: 
   49: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: 
   63: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   67:     ok.
   68: 
   69: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     L0 = lists:seq(1, 10),
   71:     L1 = my_map(fun(X) -> {x,X} end, L0),
   72:     L1 = [{x,X} || X <- L0],
   73:     L0 = my_map(fun({x,X}) -> X end, L1),
   74:     [1,2,3,4,5] = [X || X <- L0, X < 6],
   75:     [4,5,6] = [X || X <- L0, X > 3, X < 7],
   76:     [] = [X || X <- L0, X > 32, X < 7],
   77:     [1,3,5,7,9] = [X || X <- L0, odd(X)],
   78:     [2,4,6,8,10] = [X || X <- L0, not odd(X)],
   79:     [1,3,5,9] = [X || X <- L0, odd(X), X =/= 7],
   80:     [2,4,8,10] = [X || X <- L0, not odd(X), X =/= 6],
   81: 
   82:     %% Append is specially handled.
   83:     [1,3,5,9,2,4,8,10] = [X || X <- L0, odd(X), X =/= 7] ++
   84: 	[X || X <- L0, not odd(X), X =/= 6],
   85: 
   86:     %% Guards BIFs are evaluated in guard context. Weird, but true.
   87:     [{a,b,true},{x,y,true,true}] = [X || X <- tuple_list(), element(3, X)],
   88: 
   89:     %% Filter expressions with andalso/orelse.
   90:     "abc123" = alphanum("?abc123.;"),
   91: 
   92:     %% Aliased patterns.
   93:     [] = [t || {_C=_D}={_,_} <- []],
   94:     [] = [X || {X,{_Y}={X,X}} <- []],
   95:     [t] = [t || "a"++"b" = "ab" <- ["ab"]],
   96: 
   97:     %% Strange filter block.
   98:     [] = [{X,Y} || {X} <- [], begin Y = X, Y =:= X end],
   99:     [{a,a}] = [{X,Y} || {X} <- [{a}], begin Y = X, Y =:= X end],
  100: 
  101:     %% Not matching.
  102:     [] = [3 || {3=4} <- []],
  103: 
  104:     %% Non-skipping generators (each generator type)
  105:     [2,3,4] = [X+1 || X <-:- [1,2,3]],
  106:     [2,3,4] = [X+1 || <<X>> <=:= <<1,2,3>>],
  107:     [2,12] = [X*Y || X := Y <-:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}],
  108: 
  109:     %% A failing guard following a non-skipping generator is ok
  110:     [3,4] = [X+1 || X <-:- [1,2,3], X > 1],
  111:     [3,4] = [X+1 || <<X>> <=:= <<1,2,3>>, X > 1],
  112:     [12] = [X*Y || X := Y <-:- #{1 => 2, 3 => 4}, X > 1],
  113: 
  114:     %% Error cases.
  115:     [] = [{xx,X} || X <- L0, element(2, X) == no_no_no],
  116:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch [X || X <- L1, list_to_atom(X) == dum]),
  117:     [] = [X || X <- L1, X+1 < 2],
  118:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch [X || X <- L1, odd(X)]),
  119:     {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,x},_}} = (catch [E || E <- id(x)]),
  120:     {'EXIT',{{bad_filter,not_bool},_}} = (catch [E || E <- [1,2], id(not_bool)]),
  121: 
  122:     %% Non-matching elements cause a badmatch error for non-skipping generators
  123:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,2},_}} = (catch [X || {ok, X} <-:- [{ok,1},2,{ok,3}]]),
  124:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,<<128,2>>},_}} = (catch [X || <<0:1, X:7>> <=:= <<1,128,2>>]),
  125:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,{2,error}},_}} = (catch [X || X := ok <-:- #{1 => ok, 2 => error, 3 => ok}]),
  126: 
  127:     %% Make sure that line numbers point out the generator.
  128:     case ?MODULE of
  129:         lc_inline_SUITE ->
  130:             ok;
  131:         _ ->
  132:             {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,a},
  133:                      [{?MODULE,_,_,
  134:                        [{file,"bad_lc.erl"},{line,4}]}|_]}} =
  135:                 (catch id(bad_generator(a))),
  136: 
  137:             {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,a},
  138:                      [{?MODULE,_,_,
  139:                        [{file,"bad_lc.erl"},{line,7}]}|_]}} =
  140:                 (catch id(bad_generator_bc(a))),
  141: 
  142:             {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,a},
  143:                      [{?MODULE,_,_,
  144:                        [{file,"bad_lc.erl"},{line,10}]}|_]}} =
  145:                 (catch id(bad_generator_mc(a))),
  146: 
  147:             %% List comprehensions with improper lists.
  148:             {'EXIT',{{bad_generator,d},
  149:                      [{?MODULE,_,_,
  150:                        [{file,"bad_lc.erl"},{line,4}]}|_]}} =
  151:                 (catch bad_generator(id([a,b,c|d])))
  152:     end,
  153: 
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: tuple_list() ->
  157:     [{a,b,true},[a,b,c],glurf,{a,b,false,xx},{a,b},{x,y,true,true},{a,b,d,ddd}].
  158: 
  159: my_map(F, L) ->
  160:     [F(X) || X <- L].
  161: 
  162: odd(X) ->
  163:     X rem 2 == 1.
  164: 
  165: alphanum(Str) ->
  166:     [C || C <- Str, ((C >= $0) andalso (C =< $9))
  167: 	      orelse ((C >= $a) andalso (C =< $z))
  168: 	      orelse ((C >= $A) andalso (C =< $Z))].
  169: 
  170: deeply_nested(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  171:     [[99,98,97,96,42,17,1764,12,11,10,9,8,7,6,5,4,3,7,2,1]] =  deeply_nested_1(),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: deeply_nested_1() ->
  175:     %% This used to compile really, really SLOW before R11B-1...
  176:     [[X1,X2,X3,X4,X5,X6,X7(),X8,X9,X10,X11,X12,X13,X14,X15,X16,X17,X18(),X19,X20] ||
  177:         X1 <- [99],X2 <- [98],X3 <- [97],X4 <- [96],X5 <- [42],X6 <- [17],
  178: 	X7 <- [fun() -> X5*X5 end],X8 <- [12],X9 <- [11],X10 <- [10],
  179:         X11 <- [9],X12 <- [8],X13 <- [7],X14 <- [6],X15 <- [5],
  180: 	X16 <- [4],X17 <- [3],X18 <- [fun() -> X16+X17 end],X19 <- [2],X20 <- [1]].
  181: 
  182: no_generator(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  183:     Seq = lists:seq(-10, 17),
  184:     [no_gen_verify(no_gen(A, B), A, B) || A <- Seq, B <- Seq],
  185: 
  186:     %% Literal expression, for coverage.
  187:     [a] = [a || true],
  188:     [a,b,c] = [a || true] ++ [b,c],
  189:     ok.
  190: 
  191: no_gen(A, B) ->
  192:     [{A,B} || A+B =:= 0] ++
  193: 	[{A,B} || A*B =:= 0] ++
  194: 	[{A,B} || A rem B =:= 3] ++
  195: 	[{A,B} || A =:= B] ++
  196: 	[{one_more,A,B} || no_gen_one_more(A, B)] ++
  197: 	[A || A =:= 1] ++
  198: 	[A || A =:= 2] ++
  199: 	[A || A =:= 3] ++
  200: 	[A || A =:= 4] ++
  201: 	[A || A =:= 5] ++
  202: 	[A || A =:= 6] ++
  203: 	[A || A =:= 7] ++
  204: 	[A || A =:= 8] ++
  205: 	[A || A =:= 9] ++
  206: 	[B || B =:= 1] ++
  207: 	[B || B =:= 2] ++
  208: 	[B || B =:= 3] ++
  209: 	[B || B =:= 4] ++
  210: 	[B || B =:= 5] ++
  211: 	[B || B =:= 6] ++
  212: 	[B || B =:= 7] ++
  213: 	[B || B =:= 8] ++
  214: 	[B || B =:= 9].
  215: 
  216: no_gen_verify(Res, A, B) ->
  217:     Pair = {A,B},
  218:     ShouldBe = no_gen_eval(fun() -> A+B =:= 0 end, Pair) ++
  219: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> A*B =:= 0 end, Pair) ++
  220: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> B =/= 0 andalso A rem B =:= 3 end, Pair) ++
  221: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> A =:= B end, Pair) ++
  222: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> A + 1 =:= B end, {one_more,A,B}) ++
  223: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> 1 =< A andalso A =< 9 end, A) ++
  224: 	no_gen_eval(fun() -> 1 =< B andalso B =< 9 end, B),
  225:     case Res of
  226: 	ShouldBe -> ok;
  227: 	_ ->
  228: 	    io:format("A = ~p; B = ~p; Expected = ~p, actual = ~p", [A,B,ShouldBe,Res]),
  229: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: no_gen_eval(Fun, Res) ->
  233:     case Fun() of
  234: 	true -> [Res];
  235: 	false -> []
  236:     end.
  237: 
  238: no_gen_one_more(A, B) -> A + 1 =:= B.
  239: 
  240: empty_generator(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  241:     [] = [X || {X} <- [], (false or (X/0 > 3))],
  242:     ok.
  243: 
  244: no_export(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     [] = [ _X = a || false ] ++ [ _X = a || false ],
  246:     ok.
  247: 
  248: %% Test that variables in list comprehensions are
  249: %% correctly shadowed.
  250: 
  251: shadow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  252:     Shadowed = nomatch,
  253:     _ = id(Shadowed),				%Eliminate warning.
  254:     L = [{Shadowed,Shadowed+1} || Shadowed <- lists:seq(7, 9)],
  255:     [{7,8},{8,9},{9,10}] = id(L),
  256:     [8,9] = id([Shadowed || {_,Shadowed} <- id(L),
  257: 			    Shadowed < 10]),
  258:     ok.
  259: 
  260: effect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  261:     ct:timetrap({minutes,10}),
  262:     [{42,{a,b,c}}] =
  263: 	do_effect(fun(F, L) ->
  264: 			  [F({V1,V2}) ||
  265: 			      #{<<1:500>>:=V1,<<2:301>>:=V2} <- L],
  266: 			  ok
  267: 		  end, id([#{},x,#{<<1:500>>=>42,<<2:301>>=>{a,b,c}}])),
  268: 
  269:     %% Will trigger the time-trap timeout if not tail-recursive.
  270:     case ?MODULE of
  271: 	lc_SUITE ->
  272: 	    _ = [{'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  273: 		     (catch binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)) ||
  274: 		    C <- lists:seq(16#FF10000, 16#FFFFFFF)];
  275: 	_ ->
  276: 	    ok
  277:     end,
  278: 
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: do_effect(Lc, L) ->
  282:     put(?MODULE, []),
  283:     F = fun(V) -> put(?MODULE, [V|get(?MODULE)]) end,
  284:     ok = Lc(F, L),
  285:     lists:reverse(erase(?MODULE)).
  286: 
  287: id(I) -> I.
  288: 
  289: -file("bad_lc.erl", 1).
  290: bad_generator(List) ->                          %Line 2
  291:     [I ||                                       %Line 3
  292:         I <- List].                             %Line 4
  293: bad_generator_bc(List) ->                       %Line 5
  294:     << <<I:4>> ||                               %Line 6
  295:         I <- List>>.                            %Line 7
  296: bad_generator_mc(List) ->                       %Line 8
  297:     #{I => ok ||                                %Line 9
  298:         I <- List}.                             %Line 10
